body: On planes with this trait, the borders wrap in on themselves, depositing the traveler on the other side of the map. Some spherical planes are examples of self-contained, finite planes, but they can also be cubes, tori, or flat expanses with magical edges that teleport the traveler to the opposite edge when she crosses them. Some demiplanes are self-contained.
url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Planar Adventures/Planar Traits/Shape and Size/Self-Contained Shape
name: Self-Contained Shape
